meanings.sent1: The sires of the puppies were proud fathers.
meanings.sent2: The horse was the proud sire of many foals.
meanings.sent3: The sires of the lion cubs were known for their majestic manes.
meanings.sent4: In the animal kingdom, the lion is often seen as the king of sires.
meanings.sent5: The wise old elephant was respected as the sire of the herd.

meanings.sent1: The male bird sires offspring by building a nest.
meanings.sent2: The fish sires eggs in the shallow waters.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that the rooster sires chicks faster than he can count them.
meanings.sent4: The oak tree sires acorns that will grow into mighty oaks.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit sires a new litter every few weeks.

meanings.definition: To father or give birth to.
meanings.sent1: The lion proudly sires cubs in the savannah.
meanings.sent2: The mare sires a beautiful colt every spring.
meanings.sent3: The dog sires a litter of puppies that cause mischief in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The oak tree sires new life with each acorn it drops.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's cat sires kittens in the cozy barn.
